justification: “To date, the primary measures used to study SWB … are based on self-report (Diener et al., 1985; … Pavot et al., 1991 …).”  Diener 1985 and Pavot 1991 introduced the Satisfaction With Life Scale, the standard self-report tool for life-satisfaction.

The reference “New well-being measures: Short scales to assess flourishing and positive and negative feelings (Diener et al., 2010)” signals that flourishing is operationalised with the short Flourishing Scale.

The same Diener et al. (2010) citation (“Short scales to assess flourishing and positive and negative feelings”) indicates the dedicated Positive and Negative Feelings Scale used to quantify affect balance.
The article cites “The Twenty-item Toronto Alexithymia Scale--II” (Bagby et al., 1994), explicitly linking the alexithymia construct with this 20-item scale.

The reference “Levels of emotional awareness: theory and measurement of a socioemotional skill (Lane et al., 2015)” shows that emotional awareness is empirically assessed with the Levels of Emotional Awareness Scale.
